sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Care for children with severe acute malnutrition
Diet diversity in early childhood (children under 5), includes complementary feeding and MNPs

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Institutions (national – MoH and selected district) are able to plan, manage, and monitor for improved quality CMAM, micronutrient and IYCF service delivery at the time of crisis and natural disasters by 2018

description.narrative: Institutional capacity for Ministry of Health was enhanced to manage the treatment of severe acute malnutrition (SAM), micronutrient and Maternal, Infant and Young Child Nutrition interventions resulting in improved delivery of quality care for children. | Status:Met | As-of Date:19/12/2018

title.narrative: Number of adolescent girls provided with services to prevent anemia and other forms of malnutrition through UNICEF-supported programs
Percentage of health and nutrition workers trained to provide IYCF counselling services as per national standards
Percentage of districts providing care of children with SAM as part of regular health and nutrition services
Number of districts providing Micronutrient powders to children 6-23 months
Number of Sphere standards met (in relation to the management of SAM)
Number of children aged 6-59 months with SAM who are admitted for treatment
Percentage of health facilities that provide treatment services for the management of SAM
